### Offer ends 3/31/25

## Connect with internet + an Xfinity Mobile line

With 300 Mbps or higher internet speeds, you can get an unlimited line included for a year.

[Build your plan](https://www.xfinity.com/planbuilder?localize=true&drawer=internet "Build your plan")

[Pricing & other info](https://www.xfinity.com/national/#Pricing&otherinfo "Pricing & other info")

Xfinity Mobile requires Xfinity Internet. Taxes and fees extra and subj. to change. Reduced speeds after 30GB of usage/line. Data thresholds may vary.

### Online exclusive — ends 3/21

## Go with faster internet, get an Amazon Gift Card

Get Xfinity Internet at select speeds and enjoy a gift card up to $200. For new customers only.

[Shop internet](https://www.xfinity.com/planbuilder?localize=true&drawer=internet "Shop internet")

[Pricing & other info](https://www.xfinity.com/national/#Pricing&otherinfo "Pricing & other info")

Amazon.com Gift Cards never expire and can be used to shop for millions of items at www.amazon.com. Restrictions apply, see amazon.com/gc-legal.

## It pays to switch to Xfinity Mobile

## Save up to 50% vs. T-Mobile, Verizon, and AT&T

For your first year, when you get two Unlimited lines.

[Shop plans](https://www.xfinity.com/planbuilder?localize=true&drawer=internet "Shop plans")

[Calculate your savings](https://www.xfinity.com/learn/mobile/savings-calculator "Calculate your savings")

Compares two lines of Xfinity Mobile Unlimited vs. two lines of AT&T 5G Starter, Verizon 5G Unlimited Welcome, and T-Mobile Essentials Plan.

## Bring your phone, _get $100 back_

Get $10 back in monthly bill credits over 10 months. Offer ends 3/31/25.

[Check compatibility](https://www.xfinity.com/mobile/byod/compatibility/imei "Check compatibility")

[Pricing & other info](https://www.xfinity.com/national/#Pricing&otherinfo "Pricing & other info")

## _Up to $500 back_ per line to pay off your current phone contracts

For up to 5 new lines with qualifying trade-in. Offer ends 3/31/25.

[Shop plans](https://www.xfinity.com/planbuilder?localize=true&drawer=INTERNET "Shop plans")

[Pricing & other info](https://www.xfinity.com/national/#Pricing&otherinfo "Pricing & other info")

## Get iPhone 16e on us

Built for Apple Intelligence and powered by the A18 chip, iPhone 16e helps you get things done effortlessly. On us with qualifying trade-in and purchase of an Unlimited Plus line. Offer ends 3/21/25.

[Shop Apple](https://www.xfinity.com/mobile/shop/phone/iphone-16e?colorName=White&cmp=ILC:ACQ:SAP:ALL:GEN:XFM:COM:NA:syd:21920536579 "Shop Apple")

[Pricing & other info](https://www.xfinity.com/national/#Pricing&otherinfo "Pricing & other info")

Xfinity Internet required. Reduced speeds after use of monthly data included with your data option. Taxes & fees extra. Data thresholds may vary.

## Xfinity Sports & News TV

## Made for you - and the love of the game

Save $150/year over YouTube TV on our new ultimate entertainment experience:

- • 50+ channels for all-around sports and news coverage
- • Local and national stations for the biggest games and headlines
- • Peacock Premium at no extra cost (a $7.99/mo value)

$70/mo

[Build your plan](https://www.xfinity.com/planbuilder?localize=true&drawer=internet "Build your plan")

[Pricing & other info](https://www.xfinity.com/national/#Pricing&otherinfo "Pricing & other info")

Savings compares Xfinity Sports & News TV ($70/mo) to YouTube TV ($82.99/mo) and Hulu Live TV ($82.99). Xfinity Sports & News TV is $90/mo without Xfinity Internet subscription.

![Internet Essentials Logo](https://assets.xfinity.com/assets/dotcom/projects_2/cix-6845_now-and-xfinity-cross-merchandising/internet-learn/IE-XMerch-Logo-DTMobile.png)

Low cost. High speed. Still under $15/mo.

Available for eligible households and includes unlimited data and equipment. See if you qualify.

# Making Smart Simple.

Wall to wall, floor by floor, block after block, we see potential. Our goal is to customize, optimize, and personalize smart technology to empower communities and businesses to operate at their best.

### Whether you oversee multifamily properties, a chain of businesses, or somewhere in between, we partner with you to find smarter network solutions that give you more control and make your environment easier to manage.

## Smart Technology Solutions

![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27120%27%20height=%2780%27/%3e)![Smart Buildings](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/_next/static/chunks/images/icon-smart-buildings_256_75.svg)

Tools to help you manage operating costs and help improve sustainability with technology that measures air quality, detects leaks, and monitors energy usage.

## The Smartest Things Make A Difference

Every solution we help design puts the right technology in the right place for
you. Join us on a tour and see the ways that Comcast Smart Solutions can
help empower your community to operate at its best.

[Find Your Solution](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/smart-technologies/) [Share Video](mailto:?subject=Comcast%20Smart%20Solutions&body=See%20the%20ways%20that%20Comcast%20Smart%20Solutions%20can%20help%20empower%20your%20community%20or%20business%20to%20operate%20at%20its%20best%20https%3A%2F%2Fxfinity.com%2Fsmartsolutions%2F%23video)

![Comcast skyscrapers](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/_next/static/chunks/images/assets/5734549a-6ba2-4742-af26-f491036be376_3840_75.jpg)

## A Leader in Connectivity

As part of Comcast, our connectivity runs deep. Not only is it powered by the nation’s largest gig-speed network, but it also creates access to the technology our clients need to meet their goals. We leverage the latest in Comcast technology for our clients, with an array of connectivity options to support any of the custom-configured smart technology solutions that we help deploy.

[More On Connectivity](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/connectivity/)

![A smart city street showing Comcast's connectivity](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/_next/static/chunks/images/assets/7c63cad7-926c-4627-aa64-9018c538806a_3840_75.jpg)

![Two people collaborating on a smart solutions project](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/_next/static/chunks/images/assets/86c383d5-1a99-48dc-847e-8cf5eb1654c3_3840_75.jpg)

## How We Work Together

## 01  Knowledge Share

Everything starts with a clear understanding of your goals.

## 02  Solution Design

We help design the right solution(s) for your unique needs.

![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27368%27%20height=%27575%27/%3e)![circles](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/_next/static/chunks/images/logo-circles_750_70.png)

## 03  Installation

A dedicated project manager guides you through full-scale installation and training.

## 04  Post-Install Support

We partner with you to keep your smart technology working for you now and over time.

[Our Process](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/process/)

![A smart city skyline at night, powered by smart solutions](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/_next/static/chunks/images/assets/0267318c-d15c-43d3-a1d9-ba538f6d03fd_3840_75.jpg)

![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%271200%27%20height=%27500%27/%3e)![circles](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/_next/static/chunks/images/logo-circles-alt_3840_70.png)

## Partner with Us

Ready to discover how smart technology solutions can help unlock your community or business’ potential? # Video Analytics for Businesses: What Are the Benefits?

Regardless of industry, video analytics can help benefit businesses. This article will explain how Mixed-Used Developments, retail and hospitality businesses, and quick-serve restaurants can all benefit from the data and insights from a smart video solution.

August 6, 2024

## The power of video analytics: empower efficiency and productivity across your business

In today's rapidly evolving business landscape, leveraging technology for informed decision-making is crucial for businesses to stay agile and adaptive. One of the more effective tools for this is AI [video analytics](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/smart-technologies/video-analytics/), which is helping to revolutionize business operations by transforming video feeds into usable data and actionable insights.

Based on a recent report by [Fortune Business Insights](https://www.fortunebusinessinsights.com/industry-reports/video-analytics-market-101114), the global video analytics market was worth $8.37 billion in 2023 and is expected to grow to $52.67 billion by 2032. This is because more and more businesses are expected to invest in data-driven insights to significantly enhance their efficiency, productivity, and overall growth.

## Beyond security: what else does video analytics offer your business?

While video monitoring has traditionally been all about security, video analytics has since evolved into a much more robust offering with even more capabilities. By using artificial intelligence (AI) and computer vision techniques like object detection, pattern recognition, and motion analysis, intelligent video analytics (IVA) can transform video feeds into valuable insights in real-time. This means IVA can do much more than just record and monitor. It can help detect objects, track the movements of employees and guests within a store, recognize patterns and behaviors, and spot anomalies that could potentially lead to larger issues.

By going beyond simple monitoring, a video analytics solution opens a world of possibilities for businesses by turning video data into actionable insights that can help drive efficiency and productivity across various industries.

## Optimizing operations across industries using video analytics

Many industries have been able to utilize video analytics as a key tool in optimizing operations. It can offer profound insights into customer behavior and help predict future trends, enabling businesses to make well-informed decisions that can lead to streamlining operations and improving efficiency. Let’s explore how different industries are leveraging video analytics to optimize their operations.

### Commercial spaces

Traditional commercial spaces can see a tremendous positive impact with the help of video analytics solutions. By turning video footage into usable data and actionable insights, video analytics can help commercial spaces make decisions that can help them improve efficiency and operations.

## Optimize space utilization

Utilize advanced video analytics to monitor foot traffic patterns and identify underutilized areas. Transform these spaces into productive areas, such as additional seating or strategically [digital signage displays](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/smart-technologies/digital-signage/), enabling maximized value from every square foot.

## Improve access control and security

Detect unusual activity, loitering, or unauthorized access attempts, which trigger real-time alerts to security personnel. This proactive approach helps supplement existing security measures.

### Mixed-Use Developments

[Mixed-Use Developments](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/who-we-serve/mixed-use-developments/) face unique challenges that video analytics solutions can help address, as businesses, residents, and visitors each have distinct needs. By leveraging advanced video monitoring, these properties can gain vast insights to help them enhance their layout, optimize amenities, and supplement existing safety measures for all occupants and visitors.

### Analyze traffic flow to inform layout

Understand car and pedestrian traffic patterns that can determine higher trafficked areas, less used spaces, and any congestion issues. This can inform ongoing development plans.

### Care for amenities

Track usage patterns of common areas and shared spaces. This data allows for adjustments to schedules or resource allocation, helping amenities cater to resident and visitor needs.

### Video monitoring

Access footage and AI analytics from common areas, parking lots, store fronts, and perimeters for suspicious activity.

### Retail

Retail businesses can find tremendous value in video analytics. By analyzing customer behavior and interactions, retailers can gain important insights into patterns that can help improve both operations and overall customer experience. These solutions go beyond simple security footage and offer a range of features:

### Customer traffic and heat mapping analysis

Gain comprehensive insights into customer behavior through integrated foot traffic and heat mapping analysis. By tracking in-store patterns, businesses can identify peak hours, busy days, influxes based on promotions, and previously unseen trends. This approach provides valuable data to help inform strategic plans for layouts, promotions, and staffing.

### Loss prevention

Inform loss prevention strategies. Monitor and analyze store shelves and detect suspicious activity with real-time alerts that assist staff in identifying when intervention is necessary.

### Employee interactions and scheduling

Analyze various customer wait times, including initial employee interactions and checkout lines. Use this information to inform staff training and scheduling. Turn improved customer interactions and experiences into customer satisfaction and brand loyalty.

### Hospitality

Video analytics is helping to revolutionize the hospitality industry by enhancing operational efficiency and guest satisfaction. By leveraging real-time data from video feeds, hospitality businesses can help improve service quality and safety for guests.

### Optimized staffing

Understand traffic flow and wait times in main areas and amenities, like lobbies, front desks, gyms, restaurants, or shops. Update staffing plans for more strategic assignments to help provide your guests with the best experience.

### Video monitoring

AI video analytics continuously monitors for potential safety hazards, such as slip-and-fall hazards or unauthorized access to restricted zones. By detecting these issues in real time with alerts, they can be promptly addressed to help mitigate risks.

### Parking management

Utilize license plate recognition (LPR) technology to help streamline parking operations by automating vehicle tracking, preventing unauthorized access, and providing seamless access for guests.

### Quick-Serve restaurants

For highly competitive QSRs, video analytics technology has emerged as a powerful solution to elevate the customer experience and streamline operations. By harnessing the power of video analytics, QSRs can make data-driven decisions that can help enhance the customer experience.

## Drive-Thru optimization

Track and categorize wait times, bottlenecks, and lost customers through the drive-thru journey. These critical insights can inform strategic drive-thru adjustments that help customers feel well cared form, and can have a positive impact on brand loyalty and advocacy.

## Food safety & employee hygiene

Maintaining food safety and hygiene standards is essential for any QSR. Video analytics can provide real-time information about staff and food preparation areas, detecting issues such as equipment malfunctions or prep times. Video analytics can be an important tool for employee and guest safety and can help with food safety compliance.

## What businesses should consider when investing in a video analytics solution

### Choosing the right system

Choosing the right AI video analytics solutions is crucial to maximize business efficiency. When making this decision, several key factors should be considered to meet your company’s specific needs.

![](data:image/svg+xml,%3csvg%20xmlns=%27http://www.w3.org/2000/svg%27%20version=%271.1%27%20width=%27163%27%20height=%27775%27/%3e)![circles](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/_next/static/chunks/images/logo-circles-vertical_384_70.png)

## Budget

Determine the financial resources available for solutions. While IP cameras with advanced analytics features might have a higher initial cost, better-quality technology could provide greater value and lower operational costs compared to less expensive solutions.

## Desired features

Identify the specific needs of your business. Common features to consider include motion detection, people counting, journey maps, perimeter breaches, and loitering detection. More advanced features, like AI insights and machine learning capabilities, can provide deeper insights.

## Integration with existing security systems

Ensure the new solutions can integrate with existing security technologies. This includes compatibility with your existing network, scalability to add more cameras in the future, and the ability to connect with network video recorders (NVRs) for high-resolution video recording.

## Environmental considerations

Consider camera locations and surroundings when determining camera models. Cameras designed for outdoor use must be durable and capable of operating in various weather conditions. For indoor installations, factors like lighting conditions, blind spots, or other obstructions should be factored into technology selection.

### Data privacy compliance

Video analytics solutions provide so many benefits to businesses, that it has helped reshape various industries. But as with any new technology that involves data collection and storage, privacy considerations and data protection must be prioritized.

Data collected through video analytics, can include sensitive information such as facial images, license plates, and biometric details. To help mitigate these risks, business owners must invest in technologies designed to keep customer data private, secure, and protected. It is crucial to protect information from unauthorized access for privacy and legal compliance, as well as customer peace-of-mind.

To help address these privacy issues, businesses can adopt the following practices:

### Minimizing data collection

Gather only the essential data needed for security purposes and remove personally identifiable information to help protect individual privacy.

### Limit access

Ensure that only authorized personnel have access to data obtained through video analytics software.

### Establish data retention policies

Create and enforce clear policies for data retention and deletion to ensure that data is not kept longer than necessary.

## Invest in video analytics for a smarter business

Investing in video analytics is a strategic move towards a smarter, more efficient business. By leveraging the advanced insights and real-time data that video analytics can provide, you can have a meaningful impact on operations, customer experience and more.

# A Guide to Smart City Monitoring with Video Analytics

How are cities and municipalities embracing smart video technology? This article will explain
how the solution can help benefit communities and allow them to run more efficiently
through data-driven decision making.

July 24, 2024

## Building smarter cities with video analytics

As cities around the world continue to expand, they are faced with many challenges. Critical priorities such as public safety, sustainability, transportation, and infrastructure, all impact the quality of life of residents, businesses, and visitors, and are some of the many focuses of cities, municipalities, and other local governments.

To help effectively support the changing needs of their communities, cities are looking for ways to adapt and take a more proactive approach to addressing challenges. Video analytics is an important tool that can play a critical role in the growth and evolution of [smart cities](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/who-we-serve/cities-municipalities/). It is a proven solution that leverages AI and [data analytics](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/news-room/blogs-and-webinars/what-is-data-analytics/) on top of video footage and produces real-time alerts and actionable insights.

## The power of AI video analytics

Technological advancements continue to improve and expand use cases for video analytics in smart cities. Solutions now range from smarter and more advanced camera capabilities to implementing AI video analytics solutions into existing hardware and infrastructure.

Whether a city is investing in new smart camera deployments, complete with edge computing, or are incorporating advanced analytics software reading footage compatible with legacy camera systems, AI-powered video analytics can deliver sophisticated data collection, processing, and analytics capabilities. These capabilities can help detect objects, count vehicles or pedestrians, estimate quantities, identify anomalies, read movement patterns, and much more.

Equipped with these functionalities, smart video analytics can help with some of the most impactful urban problems, such as:

- Public safety and security
- Improving traffic and congestion
- Better use of public space

## How video analytics contributes to building smart cities

[Video analytics solutions](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/smart-technologies/video-analytics/) deploy advanced artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) models that can deconstruct the video feed into various data-points, such as people, trees, vehicles, pedestrians, roads, or even temperatures.

This data can then be processed to generate useful insights, such as counting the number of people at a metro station within a period of time, the number of vehicles waiting at a traffic signal – and for how long, or the number of cyclists using a bicycle lane, as well as trends over time.

## The benefits of smart video monitoring

Data generated by video analytics can be leveraged to help improve various aspects of planning, public administration, service delivery, and governance to elevate the quality of life of citizens.

### Enhanced Public Safety

Public safety is one of the most popular use cases of video analytics. The presence of a video camera can help deter criminal activity or help provide a sense of security. Cameras can also help officials respond to incidents more quickly and improve potential investigations with recorded data from a specific area and time of day. Cities can monitor specific areas like parks, or busy streets and sidewalks, and through smart search technology they have the ability to review footage by time and place by typing in a description. These live feeds and archived footage can be viewed from anywhere, helping increase security for the town.

### Optimized Traffic Management

Traffic congestion is a common problem for cities across the world, but video analytics can provide valuable data to aid in efforts to improve operational efficiency in some of the most congested parts of cities. For example, by introducing a video analytics solution, town officials can receive real-time traffic data. This data can include the identification of high traffic areas and inform future street planning to help officials provide an optimal solution for the locals . In this case, local officials can also act to reduce congestion risks; whether that be through the addition of speed bumps, no parking zones, or more speed cameras.

### Improved Resource Allocation

Efficient allocation of resources is crucial for delivering effective public services. Video analytics provides data-driven insights to empower city planners to make decisions that will have positive impacts on their benefactors. By analyzing camera feeds, planners can assess various urban elements such as green cover, lighting, road conditions, parking availability, or waterlogging. This real-time data helps them prioritize and effectively direct limited resources and manpower toward issues that need resolution.

### Data-Driven Decision Making

Video analytics can be used to provide key data points at critical times. Having access to real-time data can have a massive impact on the decisions cities make around their infrastructure, and their plans to improve it. It enables the decision-making process to be informed by genuine experience, and the outcome is far more likely to make a positive difference.

This can include scenarios such as:

## Emergency route planning

When emergency response is called out, we know every moment counts. Strong knowledge of traffic patterns across a day – and even across weeks and months – can help cities optimize first responder routes to facilitate quicker arrival on scene.

## Town center development

When growing or upgrading core communal areas, city officials want their planned changes to hit the mark and provide inhabitants and visitors with the space they need. Data insights can focus on both vehicle usage and foot traffic; enabling town centers to be developed with the right balance of pedestrian space and vehicle facilities.

## Smart search functionality

City officials often need to search databases for a saved entry – such as footage - from months back, and that function needs to be seamless and reliable. Upgrading digital infrastructures to use smart search helps create a more efficient footage recall process.

## Environmental monitoring

Green spaces are a cornerstone of any city or municipality. They are often created with the goal of mitigating the effects of pollution and reducing the urban heat island effect. Monitoring air quality across a city can help inform where these green spaces are placed.

## Energy management

With [US power use set to increase across 2024 and 2025](https://www.eia.gov/outlooks/steo/), energy usage rates are a key insight city officials can utilize to help strategize their future energy planning and inform placement of new grids and integration of renewable energy sources.

## Challenges and Considerations for Smart City Monitoring

While video analytics has the potential to improve multiple aspects of citizens’ lives, privacy best practices always need to be considered and established. Careful deliberation and planning must go into selecting and deploying the technology that will deliver on the city’s objectives, while respecting the privacy of its citizens. Video analytics solutions must be implemented in a non-invasive, anonymized manner that adheres to local laws and regulations. Steps can be taken to help address ethical and compliance challenges, including:

- Develop standards and ensure conformity
- Have transparent policies and establish accountability
- Minimize data collection and use anonymization techniques
- Establish and communicate audit practices
- Ensure legal compliance

After taking these guidelines into account, you can start to develop a plan that will allow your video analytics solution to meet the needs of those it serves.

# A Guide to Digital Signage for Retailers

Modern retailers can more easily create and control custom messaging to provide the best possible shopping experience. This article will explain the steps retailers take to implement digital signage and the potential benefits for their stores and customers.

July 12, 2024

Modern-day retail is as much about the quality of a product as it is about capturing consumers’ attention with a unique and memorable shopping experience. Competition now extends far beyond brick-and-mortar stores to include online, e-commerce, and quick-commerce retailers. [Digital signage](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/smart-technologies/digital-signage/) is an incredibly effective way to create personalized in-store moments that can transform a shopping experience from mundane to memorable. Read on to learn how smart and interactive displays are using data and analytics to help elevate consumer expectations and experiences to the next level.

## What is digital signage and why should retailers care?

Digital signage is a dynamic, multi-purpose display that works with an easy-to-operate Content Management Software (CMS). It comes in many form factors, allowing for flexible customized deployments. The cloud-based CMS and intuitive dashboard give retailers the ability to more quickly and easily manage their content across all their screens from anywhere.

Digital signage can help [Enterprise Businesses](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/who-we-serve/enterprise-business/) attract customers throughout the sales funnel. Digital signage can engage and interact with passers by, influencing them to enter stores. From there, signage can display personalized recommendations and product details to help influence purchase behavior while simultaneously updating stock availability. Finally, it can provide an interactive check-out experience, complete with managing reward programs, all while providing critical data and analytics that help support the businesses’ long-term growth.

### Advantages of digital signage for retail

Given its flexibility, ease of use, and scalability, there are many advantages of using smart digital signage in your retail business:

## Tell your brand’s story

Digital displays enable you to share the story of your brand through dynamic visuals and videos. Unlike traditional static banners and posters, you can use digital screens to build compelling narratives about your brand’s history, unique value proposition, and personality, helping to deepen your relationship with your customers while impacting purchase intent.

## Up-selling and cross-selling

Interactive displays can be a powerful sales tool that showcase relevant recommendations alongside the products already being considered. This more custom in-store experience can closely mirror an online shopping experience. Similarly, businesses can showcase similar but more expensive items for direct comparison. This strategic use of digital signage encourages customers to discover upgrades or complementary items, which can drive larger purchases.

## Interactive screens and self-checkout kiosks

Interactive signage and kiosks can provide additional support by reducing customer wait times at checkout. Transform a product directory into a billing kiosk that assists with purchases, creating a faster, more seamless experience during check-out.

![circle](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/_next/static/chunks/images/bg-circles_3840_75.png)

## How retail businesses can leverage smart digital signage solutions

Digital signage is a powerful tool for retail businesses to integrate [data analytics](https://www.xfinity.com/smartsolutions/what-is-data-analytics/) and on-the-go content management. Retail owners can help improve their business through personalization and targeted promotions, as well as content scheduling and remote management. This allows for real-time content adjustments based on consumer behavior, enhancing customer experiences and marketing effectiveness.

### Personalization and targeted promotions

Dynamic digital screens allow you to run multiple promotions simultaneously, optimizing space compared to traditional posters and banners. Digital screens also allow for time-targeted promotions at different times or on specific days, customizing offers to consumers more easily which can help drive sales during slower periods with richer offers.

### Content scheduling and remote management

With the help of a Content Management Software (CMS) platform, connected digital signage solutions allow you to manage your content from anywhere. Schedule specific campaigns to only run during particular times of the day and easily update on-the-go through an intuitive mobile app. This ability to respond quickly alleviates the pressure of having to plan and produce content for your signage weeks and months in advance, allowing you to be more flexible without printing and shipping costs.

## Creating a winning digital signage strategy for retail

### Define your goals and target audience

Digital signage can offer businesses many benefits, but it’s important to focus on your core objectives first to determine the strategy to help achieve those goals. Examples of objectives can include:

### Build brand awareness

Help define the value of your company the products you offer.

### Generate online traffic

Send in-store customers to your website via link or code, and create additional consumer touchpoints and deeper customer relationships.

### Sell more products

Design content around up- and cross-selling.

### Boost social media

Promote your social media channels and encourage consumers to engage digitally to increase brand engagement.

### Customer retention

Focus content on loyalty programs and tailored promotions to keep customers coming back.

### Inventory clearance

Run limited-time promotional campaigns to help move specific inventory items.

### Choosing the right hardware and software

Digital signage can be simple to implement once you understand its components and your content strategy. The front and back-end variables that most significantly impact your setup are the hardware and software that run your digital signage.

**Hardware**: Screens and the connected media player display your programmed content. Potential hardware form factors include televisions, digital menu boards, and other media players.

**Software**: The programs and platforms that enable you to have a seamless experience operating your screens. There ​are many​​ ​Content Management Software (CMS) options, so we recommend selecting a CMS that can handle multiple content formats (PowerPoint, text, images, playlists) and can work with multiple display units to provide you with maximum flexibility.

### Selecting the right storage solution

Storage refers to the capacity to hold data, either on local servers or in the cloud. As your operations scale, you may need to adopt cloud storage solutions to manage the increased complexity. For less complex operations, the choice between local and cloud storage can be left to the discretion of the CMS manager.

**Local Storage**: Keeping data on premises in physical servers or devices. It provides quick access and greater control over your data but requires more maintenance and physical space. With the right infrastructure and software, it can also be managed remotely.

**Cloud-based Storage**: Storing data on remote servers managed by third-party providers. It requires internet connectivity and is easily scalable, remotely accessible, and helps reduce physical maintenance costs.

The use of a storage solution offers several benefits that enhance data management and support strategic decision-making for your business. These benefits include:

## Retrieve Data Easily

Access past data effortlessly for long-term trend analysis and campaign performance evaluation.

## Ensure Data Security

Maintain data integrity and protect against loss or corruption.

## Easily Scalable

Expand storage capacity as your business grows, particularly with cloud solutions.

## Facilitate Remote Access

Access data from anywhere, enabling remote work and collaboration.

## Streamline Data Management

Use integrated tools for automated backups, version control, and data indexing to enhance efficiency.

### Designing engaging content

Implementing high-quality content is at the core of any successful digital signage strategy. Employing or partnering with a solid creative team that can design engaging and meaningful content is critical to success. Here are a few tips for creating content that works:

## ​Keep it simple

Avoid clutter and stick to the basics. Less is more on limited digital screen space. Customers may only have a moment to engage with your signage.

## ​Use visuals and videos

A mix of easy-to-read text and high-quality images can help convey your message without over-stimulating your audience.

## ​Maintain your brand identity

Your brand’s design, voice, and values should come through. Modern consumers not only care about the product but also its perception and what it represents.​

## ​Call-to-action

Directing consumers toward a decision is core to any digital strategy. Always have a thoughtfully placed CTA in your content to help convert consumer engagement into business.

## Iterate

No matter how much work has gone into your content strategy, there will always be learnings and improvements. Digital signage enables quick content updates, allowing users to swiftly optimize creative to help improve business.
